title: Spaghetti Carbonara
summary: A classic Italian pasta dish with eggs, cheese, bacon, and black pepper.
instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to boil and cook spaghetti according to package instructions.
While pasta cooks, heat a large pan over medium heat and cook pancetta until crispy.
In a bowl, whisk together eggs, grated cheeses, and plenty of black pepper.
Reserve 1 cup of pasta water before draining spaghetti.
Add hot spaghetti to the pancetta pan, remove from heat.
Quickly mix in egg and cheese mixture, adding pasta water as needed to create a creamy sauce.
Serve immediately with extra cheese and black pepper.

title: Chicken Tikka Masala
summary: Chunks of grilled chicken (tikka) cooked in a smooth buttery & creamy tomato based gravy.
instructions: Marinate chicken in yogurt, lemon juice, and 1 tsp garam masala for at least 2 hours.
Heat oil in a large pan and cook chicken until browned. Remove and set aside.
In the same pan, sauté onions until golden, then add garlic and ginger.
Add tomato puree and spices, cook for 10 minutes until oil separates.
Return chicken to pan, add cream, and simmer for 15 minutes.
Garnish with fresh cilantro and serve with rice or naan.

title: Vegetable Stir Fry
summary: Fresh vegetables quickly cooked in a wok with soy sauce and ginger.
instructions: Mix cornstarch with water to create a slurry.
Heat vegetable oil in a wok over high heat.
Add garlic and ginger, stir for 30 seconds.
Add harder vegetables first (carrots, broccoli), cook for 3 minutes.
Add remaining vegetables and cook for 2 more minutes.
Add soy sauce and sesame oil, then the cornstarch slurry.
Stir until sauce thickens, garnish with sesame seeds.

title: Chocolate Chip Cookies
summary: Classic homemade cookies with melted chocolate chips and crispy edges.
instructions: Preheat oven to 165°C (325°F) and line baking sheets with parchment paper.
Mix flour, baking soda, and salt in a bowl.
In another bowl, cream together melted butter and sugars.
Beat in vanilla, egg, and egg yolk until light and creamy.
Mix in flour mixture until just blended.
Stir in chocolate chips by hand.
Drop cookie dough onto prepared baking sheets.
Bake for 12-15 minutes until edges are lightly browned.
Cool on baking sheet for 5 minutes before transferring to wire rack.

title: Beef Tacos
summary: Crispy taco shells filled with seasoned ground beef and fresh toppings.
instructions: Heat olive oil in a pan and cook onions until translucent.
Add ground beef and cook until browned, breaking it up with a spoon.
Add taco seasoning and water according to packet instructions.
Simmer for 10 minutes until sauce thickens.
Heat taco shells according to package directions.
Fill shells with beef mixture and top with desired toppings.
Serve immediately with sour cream and salsa.

title: Greek Salad
summary: Fresh salad with tomatoes, cucumbers, olives, and feta cheese.
instructions: Combine tomatoes, cucumber, onion, and bell pepper in a large bowl.
Add olives and feta cheese.
In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, vinegar, oregano, salt, and pepper.
Pour dressing over salad and toss gently.
Let sit for 10 minutes before serving to allow flavors to meld.
Serve as a refreshing side dish or light meal.
